data.1: THE HOUR HAS come and split is the moon.
data.2: But if they see a sign they turn away, and say: "This is the same old lie continuing,"
data.3: And deny, and follow their own vain desires; but every matter is determined at its time.
data.4: Messages deterring them from evil had come to them,
data.5: Containing consummate wisdom; yet warnings were of no avail.
data.6: So turn away from them. When on the Day the crier calls to the painful business,
data.7: They will come out of the graves with downcast eyes like an expanding swarm of locusts.
data.8: They will hasten forward to the caller, gazes fixed. And the unbelievers will say: "This is the day of untold woe."
data.9: The people of Noah had denied before them, and had called Our votary a liar, and said: "He is possessed," and repulsed him.
data.10: So he prayed to his Lord: "I am helpless, deliver me."
data.11: And We opened up the flood gates of the sky with water pouring down in torrents,
data.12: And We opened up the springs of the earth; and the waters met for a decreed end.
data.13: But We bore him on a (vessel made) of planks and oakum,
data.14: Which sailed right under Our eyes: A recompense for him who had been denied.
data.15: And We left it as a sign. Is there anyone who will be warned?
data.16: How was then My punishment and My commination!
data.17: Easy have We made the Qur´an to understand: So is there any one who will be warned?
data.18: The ´Ad had also disavowed. How was then My punishment and My commination!
data.19: We let loose against them a violent roaring wind on a day of ill omen, continuous,
data.20: Which snatched away men as though they were palm trees pulled out by the roots.
data.21: How was then My punishment and My commination!
data.22: Easy have We made the Qur´an to understand: So is there any one who will pay heed?
data.24: And said: "Should we follow only one man among us? In that case we shall he in error and insane.
data.25: Was he the one of all of us to have been given the exposition? He is surely an impudent liar."
data.26: "Tomorrow they will know who is the impudent liar!
data.27: We shall send the she-camel to try them. So watch them, and be constant.
data.28: Tell them that the water is to be apportioned between them (and her); and every turn of drinking will be fixed (for each)."
data.29: But they called their commander, who seized and hamstrung her.
data.30: How was then My punishment of which they had been warned?
data.31: We sent a single blast against them, and they were reduced to husks of a decayed fence.
data.32: Easy have We made the Qur´an to understand: So is there any one who will be warned?
data.33: The people of Lot rejected the warnings.
data.34: We sent a stone-hurtling storm against them, except the family of Lot whom We saved in the early hours of the morning
data.35: As a favour from Us. That is how We reward the grateful.
data.36: He had warned them of Our might, but they passed over the warnings.
data.37: They lusted after his guests, so We put out their eyes (and said): "Taste My punishment and My commination."
data.38: And early in the morning the decreed punishment came upon them.
data.39: So now taste My punishment and My commination!
data.40: Easy have We made the Qur´an to understand: So is there any one who will be warned?
data.41: The warnings came to the people of Pharaoh.
data.42: They rejected each one of Our signs. So We seized them with the grip of one mighty and powerful.
data.43: Are the unbelievers among you any better than they? Or is there immunity for you in the Scriptures?
data.44: Or do they say: "We are a well-accoutred army?"
data.45: The army will be routed and put to flight.
data.46: Surely the Hour will be the moment of their promise, and that moment will be calamitous and distressing.
data.47: Surely the sinners are misguided and insane.
data.48: On that Day they will be dragged into the fire faces foremost, (and told:) "Taste the feel of Hell."
data.49: We have indeed created all things by measure;
data.50: And Our command is but one (word) swift as the winking of an eye.
data.51: We have destroyed the likes of you in the past: So is there any one who will be warned?
data.52: All things they do are (recorded) in the books;
data.53: All things small or great have been written down.
data.54: Surely those who fear God and follow the straight path will be amidst gardens and light,
data.55: At the still centre in the proximity of the King all-powerful.
